cards.flavorText: Those who regard the Gruul as savage simpletons underestimate the subtle power of their shamans.
cards.name: Burning-Tree Emissary

rulings.text: Burning-Tree Emissary’s ability isn’t a mana ability. It uses the stack and can be responded to.

cards.text: When Burning-Tree Emissary enters the battlefield, add {R}{G}.

cards.flavorText: Her leadership forged the Weatherlight's finest crew.
cards.name: Captain Sisay

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

cards.text: {T}: Search your library for a legendary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cryptbreaker

rulings.text: You can tap any three untapped Zombies you control, including ones you haven’t controlled continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn, to pay the cost of Cryptbreaker’s second activated ability. This includes Cryptbreaker itself.

cards.text:
{1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
Tap three untapped Zombies you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Darksteel Reactor
cards.text:
Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Darksteel Reactor.
When Darksteel Reactor has twenty or more charge counters on it, you win the game.

cards.flavorText: Oona's song is like a twisted dinner chime. All the faeries return home, but it is Oona who feasts—on the stolen dreams and rumors they serve her.
cards.name: Distant Melody

rulings.text: Note that this spell counts the number of permanents you control of the chosen type, not just the number of creatures you control. It will also take your tribal permanents into account.

cards.text: Choose a creature type. Draw a card for each permanent you control of that type.

cards.flavorText: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."
cards.name: Elvish Visionary
cards.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavorText: She wears the talismans of every creature she can evoke.
cards.name: Fauna Shaman
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavorText: A mother only a child could love.
cards.name: Goblin Matron

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, Goblin War Party is a card that references and creates Goblins, but it isn’t a Goblin card.

cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavorText: Hidetsugu never relinquished a grudge. He let it burn within him, gathering ever greater intensity until the final moment of vengeance.
cards.name: Hidetsugu's Second Rite

rulings.text: Since the player’s life total is checked only as the spell resolves, you can cast Hidetsugu’s Second Rite targeting any player, regardless of life total. If the player isn’t at 10 life as Hidetsugu’s Second Rite begins resolving, it does nothing and finishes resolving. Note that since having 10 life is not a targeting restriction, the spell won’t actually be countered for having an illegal target; it just won’t do anything.

cards.text: If target player has exactly 10 life, Hidetsugu's Second Rite deals 10 damage to that player.

cards.flavorText: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.
cards.name: Hypnotic Specter

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.flavorText: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
cards.name: Imperious Perfect
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

cards.flavorText: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.
cards.name: Kiln Fiend

rulings.text: If you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend’s ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve before the spell does.

cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavorText: Ambidexterity is common among kithkin. The thoughtweft links the minds of the left- and right-handed, giving each the knack of the other.
cards.name: Kinsbaile Cavalier
cards.text: Knight creatures you control have double strike.

cards.name: Mind Stone
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Mind Stone: Draw a card.

cards.flavorText: Regardless of the century, plane, or species, developing artificers never fail to invent the ornithopter.
cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavorText: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.
cards.name: Phyrexian Arena
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Serra Ascendant

rulings.text: If Serra Ascendant is dealt damage at the same time that you gain life (most likely because it dealt combat damage to a creature blocking or blocked by it), and your life total becomes 30 or greater, apply its last effect before considering whether or not the damage dealt to it is lethal.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, anything that cares about your life total checks your team’s life total. Serra Ascendant gets +5/+5 and has flying as long as your team has 30 or more life.

cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
As long as you have 30 or more life, Serra Ascendant gets +5/+5 and has flying.

cards.flavorText: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."
cards.name: Soul Warden

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other’s ability to trigger.

cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavorText: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.
cards.name: Tendrils of Corruption

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

cards.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

cards.flavorText: "The longer the journey, the more one learns." —Isanke, Halimar seastalker
cards.name: Treasure Hunt

rulings.text: The cards you put into your hand this way include one nonland card, plus all the land cards on top of it in your library (if any). If the top card of your library is a nonland card, you just get that one.
If all the cards left in your library are lands, you’ll reveal all of them and put them all into your hand.

cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card, then put all cards revealed this way into your hand.
